boardgame.description: In Pack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Stack the players try to fill their trucks as perfectly as possible._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players start each round with a random selection of different-sized goods, determine by the roll of several dice. Then each player takes one or two trucks from the supply face-down (numbers depend on the number of players) The trucks are revealed simultaneously and each player tries to make a quick assessment to get the truck that is most useful for his or her supply of goods. Players stack the goods in the space of their selected truck defined by the boundaries on the truck-bed and the height restriction noted on the truck. Players get negative scores if the truck they picked was too large (a lot of unused space at 1 point per unused space) or too small (a lot of goods don't fit at 2 points per space of goods that would not fit). The player who gets the lowest negative score in a round gains 10 points. Players _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;pay_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; points for their negative values, and rounds continue until at least one player no longer has any points; the player with the most points wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

KK Boardgames ~ supplier-direct games ~ your Canadian and US source for discount game prices based in Vancouver, BC and Blaine, WA. All prices in USD and all games are new and in shrink unless otherwise stated. For Canadian customers who want to pay in CAD, we can convert to CAD based on the current exchange rate. PACK _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; STACK: $39.20 Mayfair Games Availability: DIRECT ORDER - In stock at supplier. We will include the game in our next order from our supplier* *Next order date - to see our next order date click onthe _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link. If the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link is not visible, click on the user ID _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;kkrieger_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; to view our _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;geekstore_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;, then click on the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;More info..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; link for a specific game. SHIPPING: We are near the US/Canada border so we can ship from either country. We charge actual shipping cost and there are absolutely no customs fees for US and Canada orders! Multiple games can be combined in a single shipment to save you money. Shipping methods: US Orders: USPS from zipcode 98230. Canadian Orders: Canada Post from postal code V3S 1C0. International Orders: USPS Priority Mail International with insurance and return receipt. PAYMENT METHODS: 1) Paypal Instant Transfer (funded by existing funds or bank account) 2) Interac Money Transfer (Canadian bank account holders only) 3) Credit Card - 2.9% + $0.30 processing fee applies (processed by PayPal) 4) COD for local pickups in greater Vancouver (BC) area. A pre-paid deposit required for local pick-ups. Deposit is credited to your bill when you pick up your games. We will provide detailed payment instructions for you once the order is placed. CONTACT US: Although we will make an effort to respond to all questions via geekmail as quickly as possible, your response time will be faster if you send questions via email to kkboardgames+bgg@gmail.com

Mayfair Games (MFG 3308) It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s moving day! You have lots of boxes to load, and a truck to load them into-but how are they going to fit? Maybe on their ends? Stacked on top of each other? You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll have to pack your unique truck as tightly as possible, and you lose points for packing too few pieces on your truck, or for leaving pieces you can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t fit behind. Can you pack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;em, stack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;em and rack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;em with the best? Pack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Stack is a fast and funny, wild and crazy game about moving stuff on all sorts of odd trucks. Every interactive turn is a new adventure, where all the players discover new loads, grab new trucks, and then gamble on their planning and packing skills. So, test your wits and find your cool. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s time to get packin_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; and start stackin_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;! Pack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Stack contains: . 30 unique, color truck tiles . 96 wooden packing blocks . 64 color game point markers . 5 special wooden dice . 1 short rules booklet Pack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Stack is a casual, social game for 3-6 players ages 10 and older. You can play in 30-45 minutes.
Game is in EXCELLENT condition. Some rules highlighting.

German version is Zack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Pack, totally language dependent. Personally I prefer the name Zack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Pack on the box. :) Game has only been played once or twice and is in great condition.

This is the German Edition Zack und Pack. The english rules can be downloaded on BGG including three variants. Tons of Zany fun or a strategic/auction/puzzle game with the variants. We love ours! 10.70 shipping USPS Priority - UPS ground available Will combine shipping - Loopin Louie available

In Pack _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Stack the players try to fill their trucks as perfectly as possible. Players start each round with a random selection of different-sized goods, determine by the roll of several dice. Then each player takes one or two trucks from the supply face-down (numbers depend on the number of players) The trucks are revealed simultaneously and each player tries to make a quick assessment to get the truck that is most useful for his or her supply of goods. Players stack the goods in the space of their selected truck defined by the boundaries on the truck-bed and the height restriction noted on the truck. Players get negative scores if the truck they picked was too large (a lot of unused space at 1 point per unused space) or too small (a lot of goods don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t fit at 2 points per space of goods that would not fit). The player who gets the lowest negative score in a round gains 10 points. Players _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;pay_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; points for their negative values, and rounds continue until at least one player no longer has any points; the player with the most points wins.
